meanings.definition: The amount that a basin can hold.
meanings.sent1: She poured basinfuls of water into the sink to wash the dishes.
meanings.sent2: The children played in the garden, filling their buckets with basinfuls of sand.
meanings.sent3: The cat knocked over the basin, spilling basinfuls of water all over the kitchen floor.
meanings.sent4: His laughter echoed through the room, filling it with basinfuls of joy.
meanings.sent5: The storm brought basinfuls of rain, flooding the streets.

meanings.sent1: The shelves were stocked with basinfuls of fruits and vegetables.
meanings.sent2: The workers carried basinfuls of rocks to build the wall.
meanings.sent3: The market was bustling with vendors selling basinfuls of colorful candies.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes sparkled with basinfuls of excitement when she saw the surprise.
meanings.sent5: The concert hall was filled with basinfuls of music, enchanting the audience.
